meta.title: Online Maori Keyboard and Macrons
meta.description: Easily type in Maori with our online Maori keyboard - perfect for typing in te reo Māori.

faqs.question: How to use this Maori keyboard?
faqs.answer: This keyboard has been designed to mimic Microsoft's Maori IME. To type a long vowel with a macron, you can either add an acute accent before the vowel (for example ` + o will come out as ō) or type the vowel followed by = (for example o + = will also become ō). The keyboard works on both desktop and mobile, and I am always looking to improve the keyboards on this site, so please let me know if you have any suggestions.

faqs.question: What are macrons and why are they important in Maori?
faqs.answer: Macrons are horizontal lines above vowels that indicate the vowel should be held longer. In Māori, they are important because they can change the meaning of a word. For example, 'keke' means cake, while 'kēkē' can mean armpit or a duck's quack, depending on context!

faqs.question: Can I type Maori using my regular keyboard?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can type with your normal keyboard. The online tool will automatically convert your inputs into the correct Maori letters with macrons, either using the ` + vowel method or the vowel + = method.

faqs.question: Does this keyboard work on mobile?
faqs.answer: Yes, the keyboard works on both desktop and mobile devices. On mobile, you can tap the letters on the on-screen keyboard, and use the same methods for typing macrons. This makes typing Maori text much easier than relying on your device’s built-in keyboard.

faqs.question: Can I copy and share what I’ve typed?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Once you’ve typed your text in Maori with the correct macrons, you can copy and paste it anywhere — emails, documents, social media, or messages. It’s a fast and reliable way to write accurately in Maori without installing extra software.
